page.title: 04HISTORICAL SITES IN WEDMORE
page.content: The following sites are in the Borough {Stones Bakery}is partly 17th century. In the 18th_19th cent it was a lodging house. During this time a skeleton was found in the garden. The mystery was unsolved until 1872 when a certain Fanny Hardwick admitted on her death that she had helped to murder a lodger {The Market Cross}_14th Cent.It used to stand in the centre of the Borough until it was moved because horses and carts could not pass. The cross has an octagonal shaft and canopied head with the worn away figures of the Holy Rood Virgin and child,a knight and priest.{ {Barnards}dates back to the 16th Cent. and is the oldest surviving cottage in the Borough. The shop on the left used to be part of Barnards but was sold to his neighbour by a hard up owner. {Lerburne House(1845)}was built on a medieval site by Dr. John Hancock.
